documents.title: empathising with sam pepper
text: is impossible .
i mean , look at the idiot and his youtube 'prank ' which consisted of feeling up strangers and then laughing in their faces .
i use the past tense , because pepper 's fake hand ass pinch prank video has been taken down from youtube .
for those wanting to get an idea of what pepper does , however , there are a whole load more pepper videos where that came from also , a stream of largely critical responses to his vid .
what it reminded me of though was a passage from this excellent pbs documentary about how teenagers use - and are used by - social media , called generation like .
at about 23 ' , we 're introduced to baby-faced stephen fernandes , a 13-year-old from compton who started getting views for his skateboarding vids .
that was enought to get him free stuff - mainly clothes and skateboard bits .
but to get real celebrity he had to get an even bigger audience - and that meant 'pranking ' .
the doc does n't say whose idea it was , but you can be pretty sure someone told stephen to have it .
so basically , sam pepper is a massive tool , but he 's also just another tool of the entertainment industry .
and to that extent , you should probably pity him .

documents.title: the best photos you 'll see today of kanye west making like he 's a cool teacher
text: imagine an 80s classroom filled with molly ringwald , emilio estevez and ashley judd .
imagine how moody they are and how difficult it is to engage them with the educational experience .
but then this cool dude walks in yes it 's kanye west , changing lives and dreams at los angeles 's trade technical college .
he 's there as part of his community sentence for assaulting a paparazzo last year .
he 's sharing with the kids his experience of the fashion industry .
these experiences are of course manifold .
once again we have to bear witness to the fact that kanye west is on another level to most mortals .
i mean , he 's even got go faster stripes shaved into his head .

documents.title: everyone 's talking about fincher 's new gone girl
text: ca n't even look his missing wife in the eye : guilty !

/new regency pictures/sportsphoto ltd./allstar the 'first look ' reviews are out for gone girl - the david fincher directed adaptation of the best selling thriller starring ben affleck and rosamund pike .
the reviews are uniformly good .

variety 's justin chang speaks for most critics when he writez : surgically precise , grimly funny and entirely mesmerizing over the course of its swift 149-minute running time , this taut yet expansive psychological thriller represents an exceptional pairing of filmmaker and material , fully expressing fincher 's cynicism about the information age and his abiding fascination with the terror and violence lurking beneath the surfaces of contemporary american life . ''

robbie collin in the telegraph elaboratez on the point : the director is so adept at crafting concretely plausible fictions , he knows exactly which details to tweak to throw the balance slightly off .

there is a key speech in the novel in which amy [ rosamund pike ] describes the fate of the cool girl '' - the archetypal sexy girlfriend who morphs , unbidden , into a pliant wife geoffrey macnab goes further in the independent : as he has shown in films from zodiac to the social network , fincher is n't interested in tidy , taut 90 minute thrillers .

gone girl , scripted by former entertainment weekly journalist gillian flynn from her own best-selling novel , is a sprawling , multi-layered affair which is continually offering different perspectives on the same events .
it combines voice-overs and multiple flashbacks as well as a law and order-style account of what seems to be turning into a murder mystery .
somehow , fincher imposes coherence and clarity on a complex and messy storyline . ''
finally , our own xan brooks has some positive words for the leading couple : when a plot is this fevered , good casting is crucial .
happily gone girl sets out from sound first principles , neatly juggling pike 's unreadable sugar-frosted beauty with affleck 's foursquare , alpha-male cockiness .
small wonder nick soon finds himself derided as the most hated man in america '' : affleck is never better than when he is playing the louse .
he 's altogether too pleased with himself ; his grin is too smarmy .
he is saying one thing , while his face tells us another .

if an enterprising producer ever saw fit to cast affleck in a biopic of archbishop desmond tutu , it 's a safe bet that half the audience would instantly start suspecting him of plotting to murder his flock and keep mandela in jail . ''
oh and did we mention ?
you can read an exclusive interview with david fincher in this saturday 's guide .

documents.title: monday 's tune suppository
text: ariel pink - put your number in my phone la weirdo returns with a piece of unsettlingly sweet jangle and a video that references midnight cowboy is that elton john in the hat ?
saa - ( k ) new you icy electro pop ( is there any other kind ) from this norwegian artist .
it has some nice squelches and spooky distortions in it too .
sbtrkt - the light ft denai moore a low key roller from the new sbtrkt album .
it may have had mixed reviews but the man in the mask still knows how to craft a bit of atmos .
hudson mohawke mix featuring kanye west , madlib , rustie etc what it says on the tin really .
glaswegian beatmaker to the stars serves up hip hop themed mix on bbc 's diplo show .
listen to the new aphex twin album in full ( via spotify )

documents.title: is this cool ?
text: caviar drops down to number # 21 source / alamy/alamy released today is the list of 'britain 's coolest brands ' .
now the title may tell you all you need to know ( 'brands ' ) but there is an element of interest in peeking at the list , seeing how it 's dominated by luxury brands ( so punk ! )
apart from , er , glastonbury who pops up at five ( must be something to do with the luxury teepees ) .
how many logos on this list would you have tattooed on your buttocks ?
let us know in the comments !

1 apple2 aston martin3 nike4 chanel5 glastonbury6 google7 youtube8 dom perignon9 rolex 10 netflix11 bang & olufsen12 ray-ban13 alexander mcqueen14 instagram15 bose16 liberty17 selfridges18 sony19 virgin atlantic20 stella mccartney and by way of clarification , here 's the criteria for entry from the 'coolbrands ' site stephen has also acted as an expert witness in legal brand disputes

documents.title: transcript : what sir roger moore had to say about hoth
text: roger moore in aachen , germany vennenbernd/ rolf vennenbernd/dpa/corbis it 's the breaking story of the day , roger moore has been to hoth .

at least that is what professional star wars enthusiasts reckon after having heard his interview with graham norton on saturday we reprint the transcript of the exchange for your information , and also for the opportunity to have a laugh at sir roger 's thoughts on the philippines roger moore : anyway , the day before last , i know we stopped by the office , and i went up to see - on a very closed , secret set - my friend j. j. abrams , who is producing/directing star wars .
graham norton : ooh , wow !
moore : with harrison ford .
norton : so , what were they filming that day ?
can you tell me ?
moore : well , yes !
they were filming something with a lot of mountains and snow .
norton : okay , hmm .
moore : but i was signed to secrecy .
norton : did you really have to sign a thing ?
moore : oh , erm no .
both : [ laugh ] norton : it would n't surprise me !
they are crazy , those people , so moore : but they have to be secret about it !

what happens with film is that , somehow or another , people get their hands on outtakes and prints , and they print them and they sell them for television in the philippines - i had a filipino working for us years ago and he said oh , my family have already seen the film , '' which had n't even had its royal premiere !
norton : oh !
that 's extraordinary , is n't it ?
it 's like when you go to china and there 's new harry potter books !

bulletin.text: It's an odd day full of unexpected associations and jaw-dropping revelations (or at least jaw-opening).
Perhaps it's an augur of the end of the world.
Let us know if you agree by posting in the comments below. Or on twitter @twitterid.
